transcripts.text: Some voters still haven't placed their ballots, but for some, possibly voting early, maybe they have a little remorse on their selection.  Joining me to talk more about that, as well as a new poll surrounding Democratic candidate Joe Biden's knowledge surrounding his son's controversial business dealings, is New York Post columnist Miranda Devine.  Good morning, Miranda.  How you doing?
Good morning, Paul.  Great to talk to you.

It's good always to talk to you once again.  Usually with a story of your magnitude, three things happen.  There's a denial from the alleged perpetrator.  There's an explosion of investigative reports following up.  And then there's the discrediting of the whistleblower.  As it relates to this story, have any of those three things happened?

Only number three, unfortunately.  Big censorship has happened to the New York Post story about Hunter Biden's laptop from hell.  And it's day 13 today that Twitter has locked the New York Post Twitter account.
But it's important to note that there's not been a hint of denial out of the Biden campaign as it relates to this, right?

No.  Look, he has been asked a couple of times by a couple of intrepid journalists, and he just gets quite angry and says, no, it's just a big lie.  But he's not answering whether or not he was the big guy named in that laptop, you know, in all these emails that was receiving money from China or that he was part of the deal that his family was – was involved in, in peddling influence overseas.  So, but, you know, despite all this censorship, basically, from the rest of the media and Facebook and Twitter, it seems that the American people have found out about the story.  as usual censorship backfires.  And that interesting poll that you mentioned in Rasmussen yesterday shows that a majority of Americans think that Joe Biden actually knew about Hunter Biden's shady deals overseas and also may have benefited from them.  And when you look at Republicans, 83 percent of them think that.  But Democrats seem to be just in the dark or not wanting to know about it because only about 30 percent of them feel that way.

So then what do people who voted early, is there any recourse?  Say you're troubled by this news.  Some will be, some won't be.  But say that you are and you've already cast your vote and now you want to reconsider.  What's a voter to do?

Well, as you can see, a lot of voters are trying to find that out because there's been a spike in Google searches for how can I change my vote?  In New York, you can have voters remorse and you can actually change your vote on election day.  But in most states, you can't.  It's just once you've done it, that's it.  So it's one of the perils of early voting, I think.  I know that This year, because of the pandemic, it was a necessity for some people.  But you really miss out on a lot of the extra information that comes to a head by the end of the election campaign.  And you perhaps are voting without knowing the full story about the candidate you're voting for.

A name almost out of central casting, the central figure, Tony Bobulinski.  is at the heart of this.  He's a former Hunter business associate.  What is his motivation for going public this late in the game?

Look, he basically his name came up because when the Hunter Biden laptop emerged and we looked at the emails on it, his was one of the names in that email chain.  And so he was approached by Ron Johnson's Senate committee and asked to come and testify.  He agreed to do so.  Then the FBI now has contacted him and asked for the contents of his three telephones.  And he just decided that he would come clean.  I think he was disgusted.  I mean, he's a Democrat supporter.  He's a former naval lieutenant.  He's an upright man, a former Penn State wrestler.  And he just felt that what was going on in the Biden family was wrong.  And he felt that his reputation was tarnished by involvement.  So he wanted to get out ahead of the story.  and explain what he saw.  And what he saw was that Joe Biden knew exactly what was going on.
So he's going to be on Tucker Carlson tonight for the entire hour.  What other shoes could possibly fall on this before, as we're one week out from the election?

Look, I just think it's the overwhelming weight of evidence and the credibility of this man who probably is, you know, the most serious person person to challenge Joe Biden's stories about what his son has been up to.  I mean, we've heard Joe Biden tell us for years that he knew nothing about what Hunter Biden was doing overseas, even though Hunter Biden travelled with him on Air Force Two to China for that eight-day visit and came away with that massive $1.5 billion deal with the subsidiary of the Bank of China and various other lovely perks that his father introduced him to.  So Unfortunately, Joe Biden is has been shown by all this evidence and by Tony Bobulinski's very credible testimony to not have been being truthful with the American people.  And, you know, so close to an election, it probably won't make much difference, but it doesn't absolve Joe Biden from the need to come clean with the American people.

All right.  Well, maybe that'll happen between now and Election Day.  He seems to be calling a lid pretty early almost every day as we come right down to the election.  Miranda, looks like you need an umbrella today.  So stay dry and we'll chat again, OK?
Thanks.  Thanks a lot, Paul.  Good talk.
Miranda Devine from The New York Post, everybody.
